metadata.title: Modelagem do processo de atendimento utilizando o software Arena para simular tráfego pago de uma loja online
metadata.description: O atendimento ao cliente é um dos principais pilares de um negócio e neste estudo escolhemos uma loja online de jóias e perfumes que não utiliza nenhum sistema automatizado para atendimento que funciona através de um aplicativo de mensagens. A empresa irá investir em tráfego pago onde receberá mensagens 24h por dia de clientes que foram direcionados por anúncios de redes sociais e com isso surgiu a preocupação para entender esse fluxo de clientes novos na fila de atendimento. Para a análise do processo, coletamos dados que indicam intervalos para tempo de chegada da mensagem, tempo de espera na fila e atendimento, com estes dados, criamos um modelo para processar através do software de simulação Arena. Após realizar estes processos no sistema Arena, a proposta é obter melhorias para a redução das filas.

metadata.title: Dataset of measurements of the soil temperature and thermal gradients at Le Biancane (geothermal field of Larderello-Travale, Tuscany, Italy) in September 2023
metadata.description:
Dataset of measurements of the soil temperature and thermal gradients at Le Biancane (geothermal field of Larderello-Travale, Tuscany, Italy) in September 2023. The dataset is structured as follows:

Column A is the progressive number of the point (#);

Column B is the Identifier of the poiin (ID)

Column C is Longitude of the point, datum WGS 1984;

Column D is the Latitude of the point, datum WGS 1984;

Column E is the Universal Transverse Mercator (UTM) Longitude coordinate, datum WGS 1984, zone 32N;

Column F is the Universal Transverse Mercator (UTM) Latitude coordinate, datum WGS 1984, zone 32N;

Column G is the soil temperature by K thermocouple, in °C;

Column H is the soil thermal gradient, in °C/m (degrees Celsius per meter);

Column I is the date (dd/mm/yyyy hh:mm)

metadata.title: Low Reynolds Number Modeling of Pulsatile Blood Flow Through Stenosed Artery for Hemodynamic Analysis
metadata.description: This study investigates pulsatile and non-pulsatile blood flow through a 3D human artery with 50% stenosis. A time-dependent fully developed parabolic velocity profile is modeled into two phases of cardiac cycle. The hemodynamic properties are analyzed at peak of systole, a random point, and peak of diastole of cardiac cycle and the results are compared with non-pulsatile case. A pressure drops and acceleration of velocity due to high-velocity gradient leading a high wall shear at the stenosed region. The velocity was measured to 2.73 m/s for pulsatile flow at the peak of the systole and 1.15 m/s for non-pulsatile.
keywords: Pulsatile blood flow, stenosed artery, hemodynamic properties, turbulence intensity

metadata.title: Re-gridded Geothermal Heat Flow data sets (Supplementary material for Lösing et al. (2025): Community Heat Flow Recommendations: Suitable Basal Boundary Conditions for Greenland and Antarctica in ISMIP7.)
metadata.description:
These datasets are supplementary material to the publication from Lösing et al., (2025): Community Heat Flow Recommendations: Suitable Basal Boundary Conditions for Greenland and Antarctica in ISMIP7. 

When using these data, please cite the original datasets and papers, as well as the accompanying publication. 

The Colgan & Wansing (2021) data has been reprojected to Polar Stereographic (EPSG:3413) and upsampled to the resolution BedMachine Greenland v5 (150 m; Morlighem et al., 2017, 2022) using bilinear interpolation. 

The Stål et al. (2020) and Lössing & Ebbing (2021) datasets have been reprojected to Antarctic Stereographic (EPSG:3031) when needed and have been upsampled to BedMachine Antarctica v3 (500 m; Morlighem et al.,2022) using bilinear interpolation. 

The original Aq1 dataset from Stål et al. (2020), including uncertainty metrics, was cropped at the coastline and grounding line due to the extent of some observables used. To facilitate regridding, we applied a buffered nearest neighbour extrapolation technique to create a processed version of the dataset (aq1_nn_extrapol.nc). We created a spatial buffer extending 4 grid cells (equivalent to 80 km given the 20×20 km resolution) around the valid values in Aq1 using morphological dilation with a circular kernel. We then applied nearest neighbour extrapolation to fill all NaN values across every variable in the dataset, followed by masking to retain only the extrapolated values within the 80 km buffer zone. This approach preserves the original model while adding a controlled "corona" of extrapolated values that extends smoothly into previously undefined regions, reducing edge effects and discontinuities that could occur during regridding procedures.

We further include topographic correction fields for Antarctica (TopoHeat_Antarcticanc) and Greenland (TopoHeat_Greenland) from Colgan et al. (2021) as well as the original GHF datasets from Stål et al. (2020), Colgan & Wansing (2021), and Lösing & Ebbing (2021).
